initiate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan
initiate.translation[0].definitions[0].e: They have decided to initiate legal proceedings against the newspaper.
Intellectuals have initiated a debate on terrorism.
initiate.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to tell someone about something or show them how to do something
initiate.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Those kids were initiated into heroin use at a young age.
initiate.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to introduce someone into an organization, club, group etc, usually with a special ceremony
initiate.translation[0].definitions[2].e: At the age of thirteen, the boys in the tribe are initiated into manhood.
initiate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: someone who has been allowed to join a particular organization, club, or group and has been taught its secrets
